meanings.definition: To sell or promote (something) aggressively or enthusiastically.
meanings.sent1: The salesman tried to supersell the new product to every customer who walked into the store.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to supersell the latest items in the store to boost sales.
meanings.sent3: The enthusiastic seller decided to supersell the idea of a pet rock to the skeptical audience.
meanings.sent4: The marketing team managed to supersell the benefits of the new software, making it irresistible to potential buyers.
meanings.sent5: With his charismatic personality, he could supersell anything to anyone.

meanings.definition: A person who sells aggressively or enthusiastically.
meanings.sent1: The supersell at the car dealership was known for his persuasive techniques.
meanings.sent2: She became the top supersell in the company due to her exceptional sales skills.
meanings.sent3: The supersell at the electronics store could convince anyone to buy the latest gadgets.
meanings.sent4: In the world of sales, being a supersell can lead to great success and rewards.
meanings.sent5: The young entrepreneur aspired to become a supersell in the competitive market.
